name: slummy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of an area, especially in a city) very poor and crowded: She found herself in a slummy back street. In the 1950s, he took photographs of New York that portrayed the city as slummy, trashy, and damaged.
UK untidy or dirty: We'll see how long it takes him to get fed up with dear Daddy and his slummy ways. See
slum
More examplesFewer examplesHe wanted to revive the city's remaining three kilometres of filthy, slummy wasteland.Her friends thought she was nuts to buy an empty building on a slummy street in Portland.She died in a slummy room with his picture on the wall.
